Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Sam Altman called an OpenAI board member’s research paper a danger to the company weeks before he was ousted as its chief executive.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Context of conflict with board member over research paper

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Context of tension within OpenAI's board

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Some board members worried that Mr. Altman was too focused on expansion while they wanted to balance that growth with A.I. safety.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Context of tension within OpenAI's board regarding growth and safety

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: The decision stunned OpenAI’s employees and exposed board members to tough questions about their qualifications to manage such a high-profile company.

The OpenAI debacle has illustrated how building A.I. systems is testing whether businesspeople who want to make money from artificial intelligence can work in sync with researchers who worry that what they are building could eventually eliminate jobs or become a threat if technologies like autonomous weapons grow out of control.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Context of challenges in building A.I. systems

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Helen Toner, an OpenAI board member, defended the research paper she co-wrote.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: Director of Strategy, Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology; OpenAI Board Member
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Context of conflict with Sam Altman over research paper

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival...
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Email to colleagues regarding research paper

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “I did not feel we’re on the same page on the damage of all this,” he wrote in the email. “Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.”
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Email to colleagues regarding research paper

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed...
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Context of concerns about A.I. and discussion about removing Helen Toner

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,”
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Statement regarding co-founders' exit from OpenAI

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Statement regarding co-founders' exit from OpenAI

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Jason Kwon, OpenAI’s chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Video call with board members after Sam Altman's ousting

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board’s mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that “benefits all of humanity,” and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: Director of Strategy, Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology; OpenAI Board Member
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Video call with board members after Sam Altman's ousting

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “I deeply regret my participation in the board’s actions.”
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Post on X (formerly Twitter) regarding Sam Altman's ousting
